tool.name: ntwrkPts_scs
tool.displayname: 1: Make Network Points from Procedural Features
tool.summary: Given a set of Procedural Features, creates points along the hydrological network.

param.name: in_PF
param.dialogReference: Input feature layer or feature class representing Procedural Features.

param.name: out_Points
param.dialogReference: Output SCS Points feature class, associated with Procedural Features along the hydrological network

param.name: in_NWI
param.dialogReference: Input Wetlands layer, used for defining Tidal wetlands

param.name: fld_SFID
param.dialogReference: Field in Procedural Features used to identify unique Source Features.

param.name: fld_Tidal
param.dialogReference: Field in Wetlands layer used to indicate if the wetland is tidal.

param.name: out_Scratch
param.dialogReference:
Scratch geodatabase specified to store temporary/intermediate data.

If not specified, intermediate data will be stored in memory and will not persist; this is preferred for faster processing. It is recommended that you only specify a scratch geodatabase if you need to trouble-shoot poor automation results, or if your computer has insufficient memory for processing large datasets.

idCitation.resTitle: 1: Make Network Points from Procedural Features

dataIdInfo.idAbs:
Given a set of Procedural Features, creates points along the hydrological network.

The user must ensure that the procedural features are "SCU-worthy."
dataIdInfo.idCredit: Virginia Natural Heritage Program (Kirsten Hazler, David Bucklin)
